comments:
After installing Eclipse in clean room (getting welcome page on first bootup) of the following archives:

DIST_ECLIPSE_32BIT="eclipse-SDK-M20060912-1730-linux-gtk.tar.gz"
DIST_EMFSDOXSD="emf-sdo-xsd-SDK-M200609071016.zip"
DIST_GEF="GEF-SDK-3.2.zip"
DIST_VE="VE-SDK-1.2.zip"
DIST_BIRT="birt-report-framework-sdk-2_1_0.zip"
DIST_CDT_32BIT="org.eclipse.cdt.sdk-3.1.0-linux.x86.tar.gz"
DIST_DALI="dali-R-0.5-200606282232.zip"
DIST_JEM="JEM-SDK-M20060912.zip"
DIST_WTP="wtp-sdk-M-1.5.1-200609150551.zip"
DIST_JSF="wtp-jsf-sdk-M-1.5.1-200609150551.zip"
DIST_TPTP="tptp.runtime-TPTP-4.3.0-200609150100.zip"
DIST_TPTP_SDK="tptp.sdk-TPTP-4.3.0-200609150100.zip"
DIST_TPTP_JVMTI="jvmti-client-TPTP-4.2.0.2.zip"
DIST_DTP="dtp-sdk_1.0M1.zip"

I then went on to install ATF atf-linux-sdk-0.1-20060912-1300.zip from "New Archived Site" in update manager.

During the update process I am shown the License agreements, I select "Agree" and click the Next button and the following exception occurs.

Clicking Next again does not make another exception occur, but clicking Back button in the wizard, has the abnormal effect of making the 4 features listed get duplicated down the left hand side (on the license agreement page "Feature License") and clicking back again makes the dialog go back to where I expect (the feature selection page "Search Results")

The license agreement dialogue does not advance so I am unable to install ATF after installing this specific set of plugins.  I have deleted my Eclipse installation and my -configuration and workspace and started over and confirmed repeating the problem by being able to repeatidly demonstrate it.

I have narrowed down the problem a little.  First of all I made the configuration more leaner only installing:

DIST_ECLIPSE_32BIT="eclipse-SDK-M20060912-1730-linux-gtk.tar.gz"
DIST_EMFSDOXSD="emf-sdo-xsd-SDK-M200609071016.zip"
DIST_GEF="GEF-SDK-3.2.zip"
DIST_JEM="JEM-SDK-M20060912.zip"
DIST_WTP="wtp-sdk-M-1.5.1-200609150551.zip"

This being WTP + Its prerequisites, which are all need for ATF to be installed.


After my clean room install from ZIPs I run the command:

eclipse/eclipse -clean -initialize


If I run this command after I unzipped everything then I always get the exception.  If I simply omit this command and run eclipse like normal to use it, then Update Manager works as I except and no exception occurs.

Just to clarify the procedure:

* Delete the tree eclipse lives in /opt/eclipse
* Delete the configuration area eclipse uses $HOME/.eclipse
* Delete the workspace $HOME/workspace_clean
* Unzip all the file from /opt, creating /opt/eclipse/

* Run eclipse/eclipse -clean -initialize

* Bootup Eclipse like normal (eclipse/eclipse -clean -configuration file:///home/dlm/.eclipse/org.eclipse.platform_3.2.0/empty/ -data /home/dlm/workspace_clean)
* Close the welcome screen view
* Goto Help -> Software Updates -> Find and Install
* Search for New Features
* Ensure ATF is ticked (which I added thru "New Archived Site")
* Finish
* Busy dialog shows while it searchs
* Tick ATF again
* Next
* Select "I Accept ..."
* Next (exception happens here)

I have the same problem trying to install mylar from update site

http://download.eclipse.org/technology/mylar/update-site/e3.2
Note I am on win32 platform
